cards.title: Cycling / Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour
cards.rawTitle: Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour

item.title: Lizzie Armitstead crashes at finish line during Women’s Tour
item.trailText: The Olympic silver medallist Lizzie Armitstead crashes at the end of the first stage of the Women's Tour on Wednesday
item.standFirst:
The Olympic silver medallist Lizzie Armitstead crashes at the end of the first stage of the Women's Tour on Wednesday. Armitstead is seen crossing the line first following the leg from Bury St Edmunds to Aldeburgh and then brushing a photographer while celebrating. The 26-year-old was later taken to hospital

Warning: video contains images that may disturb

cards.title: Women's Tour of Britain / A rider's-eye view from Bury St Edmunds to Aldeburgh
cards.rawTitle: A rider's-eye view from Bury St Edmunds to Aldeburgh

item.title: Tour of Britain: a rider's-eye view from Bury St Edmunds to Aldeburgh
item.trailText: A view over the handlebars of the cyclists competing in the first stage of the women's Tour of Britain on Wednesday
item.standFirst: A view (Google Street View, to be precise) over the handlebars of the cyclists competing in the first stage of the women's Tour of Britain on Wednesday. Glide through leafy Suffolk in mere seconds as the peloton travels from historic Bury St Edmunds to the coast at Aldeburgh. The event is the biggest women's cycling race in the UK, with a total of 16 teams and a field that includes 12 different national champions and seven of the 10 highest-ranked riders in the world

cards.title: NBA finals / Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after title triumph
cards.rawTitle: Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after title triumph

item.title: NBA finals: Warriors fans fill streets of Oakland after taking title to Golden State
item.trailText: Golden State Warriors supporters celebrate in Oakland after their team won the NBA championship
item.standFirst: Golden State Warriors celebrate in Oakland after their team won the NBA championship. The California franchise beat LeBron James's Cleveland Cavaliers, winning 105-97 in game six to take the title to Oakland

stillImage.caption: OAKLAND, CA - JUNE 16:  Golden State Warriors fans celebrate their team's 2015 NBA Finals win Photograph: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images North America Photograph: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images North America

cards.title: US Open / Kaymer ready to defend title at Chambers Bay
cards.rawTitle: Kaymer ready to defend title at Chambers Bay

item.title: Martin Kaymer ready to defend US Open title at Chambers Bay
item.trailText: Martin Kaymer, the 2014 US Open champion, comments on the set-up of Chambers Bay and defending his title
item.standFirst: Martin Kaymer, the 2014 US Open champion, comments on the set-up of the Chambers Bay course, and defending his title. Jordan Speith, the 2015 Masters champion, also speaks to the press about the challenges of the US Open and Henrik Stenson compares the course with that of The Open

cards.title: In pictures / Golden State Warriors crowned NBA champions
cards.rawTitle: Golden State Warriors crowned NBA champions

item.title: Golden State Warriors are crowned 2015 NBA champions
item.trailText: Golden State Warriors are NBA champions after easing past Cleveland Cavaliers 105-97 at the Quicken Loans Arena, Cleveland, Ohio, to seal a 4-2 series victory. It is their first title in 40 years
item.standFirst: Golden State Warriors are NBA champions after easing past Cleveland Cavaliers 105-97 at the Quicken Loans Arena, Cleveland, Ohio, to seal a 4-2 series victory. It is their first title in 40 years

cards.title: In pictures / Chicago Blackhawks win the Stanley Cup
cards.rawTitle: Chicago Blackhawks win the Stanley Cup

item.title: Chicago Blackhawks win the Stanley Cup
item.trailText: The Chicago Blackhawks win the Stanley Cup after defeating the Tampa Bay Lightning 2-0 in game six at the United Center in Chicago, Illinois
item.standFirst: The Chicago Blackhawks won the Stanley Cup after defeating the Tampa Bay Lightning 2-0 in game six at the United Center in Chicago, Illinois

displayImages.caption: A general view of the United Center before the final. Photograph: Caylor Arnold/USA Today Sports
displayImages.altText: A general view of the United Center before the final.
displayImages.cleanCaption: A general view of the United Center before the final.

cards.title: Basketball / Paris – where street basketball meets hip-hop
cards.rawTitle: Paris – where street basketball meets hip-hop

item.title: Paris: where street basketball meets hip-hop
item.trailText: Quai 54 is the biggest street basketball championship in Europe, played in the centre of Paris against a backdrop of the Champs-Élysées and the Eiffel Tower
item.standFirst:
Quai 54 is the biggest street basketball championship in Europe, played in the centre of Paris against a backdrop of the Champs-Élysées and the Eiffel Tower. Iman Amrani had courtside access to the event and went to explore the relationship between basketball and hip-hop with French artists and dancers including Les Twins, Dosseh, Sadek and Joke

• WARNING: explicit lyrics (in French)
item.byline: Max Whittle, Iman Amrani and Juliet Riddell

stillImage.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Paris; where streetball meets hip hop  - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk
stillImage.altText: 620x372 trailpic for Paris; where streetball meets hip hop  - video
stillImage.cleanCaption: 620x372 trailpic for Paris; where streetball meets hip hop  - video

displayImages.caption: 620x372 trailpic for Paris; where streetball meets hip hop  - video Photograph: guardian.co.uk
